summary: The Working Families Task Force Act of 2025 proposes establishing an interagency task force, led by the Secretary of Labor, to address challenges faced by working families in America. The task force will examine factors impacting standards of living, develop recommendations for improvement, and submit a report to Congress. Key areas of focus include affordability, job quality, childcare, tax policies, healthcare, housing, education, financial literacy, access to food and technology, and environmental and energy concerns. The task force will consult with external stakeholders and public experts.
